author: Alberto Silva
title: Nuevo León 'se asa' con más de 200 incendios en un solo día
text:
Los incendios ‘acechan’ a Nuevo León: unos 200 incendios se han registrado esta semana, mientras empeoran las condiciones del clima en la región.
El Gobierno de Nuevo León ha informado sobre la detención de cinco personas, quienes presuntamente habrían provocado incendios en el municipio de García.
Samuel García Sepúlveda, gobernador del estado, dijo que pedirán prisión preventiva para al menos tres de los involucrados y que harán todo su esfuerzo para que quienes provoquen incendios en Nuevo León, reciban castigo con todo el peso de la ley.
“Pedir a la mesa (de coordinación metropolitana) que me ayuden siendo muy proactivos, tenemos ya evidencia, al menos del municipio de García, de delincuentes que provocaron los incendios, ahí nos pasaron los videos”, expuso Samuel García.
“Nos pasaron el ‘modus operandi’; como con estacas ya bañadas en gasolina, por un dinerito van y prenden un baldío”, agregó.
El mandatario estatal dijo que uno de los implicados confesó haber recibido como pago 300 pesos para provocar el incendio que generó cuantiosas pérdidas en García.
“Ya tenemos pérdidas económicas por 300 millones en García, cinco empresas se quemaron, yo les pido ir por ellos todo el peso de la ley”, dijo el mandatario.
Advirtió que los provocadores de incendios recibirán todo el peso de la ley, por generar cuantiosos daños materiales y por provocar el despliegue que puso en riesgo a decenas de bomberos y rescatistas.
“No se vale, y es completamente imperdonable que esta gente por cualquier motivo económico o político pongan en peligro vidas”, dijo García.
Las autoridades estatales informaron que durante la jornada más crítica se reportaron 239 incendios en un lapso de 5 horas, de los cuales tres siguen activos, pero bajo control.
Se trata de los incendios en Santa Catarina, García y otro en la Sierra de Picachos.
Esta tarde, el alcalde de García, Manuel Guerra Cavazos informó que el incendio aledaño a diversas plantas industriales en la zona del Alcali, se había reactivado con intensidad lo que provocó el cierre total de la carretera a García, también conocida como la avenida Heberto Castillo.
Levantan contingencia ambiental en Nuevo León
Además de los daños provocados en varias empresas, la racha de incendios provocó una calidad del aire extremadamente mala en gran parte de la zona metropolitana de Nuevo León.
Al arranque de la jornada, algunas estaciones como la ubicada en el municipio de Santa Catarina se encontraban en color morado, es decir con calidad del aire extremadamente mala; otras estaciones mostraban muy mala calidad.
La contingencia ambiental fue activada desde el martes, por parte de la Secretaría de Medio Ambiente de Nuevo León, que implica la reducción de trabajos por parte de las Industrias así como la suspensión de actividades al aire libre en planteles escolares y clubes deportivos.
Desde ayer por la tarde el cielo de la ciudad y los municipios metropolitanos fueron cubiertos por una nube color negro generada por los diversos incendios y las fuertes rachas de viento.
Además se reportó la caída de ceniza en lugares alejados de los siniestros.
Sin embargo, la contingencia en Nuevo León ha sido ya retirada la tarde de este miércoles.

author: Dr. Jerry Doby
title: Vic Shadez Goes “CRAZY” on This Self-Produced Dark Banger
text: [Rhyme Report](https://www.thehypemagazine.com/category/music/) Published on January 5th, 2024 | by Dr. Jerry Doby0 Vic Shadez Goes “CRAZY” on This Self-Produced Dark Banger New Jersey’s very own wordsmith and beatsmith, Vic Shadez, casts a probing gaze into the enigmatic interplay between reality and perception with his latest musical offering, “CRAZY.” This compelling track serves as the inaugural chapter to his much-anticipated album, TIMETRAVELER, setting a profound tone for introspection within a cacophony of societal chaos. A Darkly Captivating Soundscape and Visuals Shadez, the maestro behind the song’s production, constructs a shadowy auditory landscape that masterfully mirrors the tempestuous journey of the human psyche. The accompanying music video, artfully directed by G.I.FILMS, unveils an eerie film noir aesthetic, inviting viewers into the nebulous realm of liminality. Within this space, the experience of navigating one’s own mental labyrinth amid the relentless deluge of information is vividly portrayed. Challenging the Status Quo In a thought-provoking statement, Shadez revealed, “CRAZY aims to provoke listeners into confronting the nebulous boundary between reality and perception, prompting introspection on the omnipresent question – do our minds teeter on the brink of madness in this inundation of ever-evolving information? They labeled Dave Chapelle and Kanye as ‘crazy’… now, we’re all caught in this chaotic web.” A Provocative Prelude to an Intriguing Journey “CRAZY,” available across all platforms via GIDDT//AVM, not only beckons listeners into a contemplative auditory experience but also lays the groundwork for Shadez’s forthcoming LP, TIMETRAVELER. Promising an enthralling exploration of the human psyche, the [album](https://www.thehypemagazine.com/category/music/) portends a captivating odyssey that pushes the boundaries of musical introspection. Connect with Vic Shadez and Galactic Push Twitter: Vic Shadez – [@VicShadez](https://twitter.com/VicShadez) Instagram: Vic Shadez – [@VicShadez](https://twitter.com/GalacticPush) In the wake of “CRAZY,” Vic Shadez’s musical journey promises to be a thought-provoking expedition through the corridors of the human mind, inviting all to question their own perceptions in an increasingly frenetic world. [Tweet](https://twitter.com/share?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

author: Wade Peery
title: Clemson unveils new basketball court inside Littlejohn Coliseum
text: Clemson unveils new basketball court inside Littlejohn Coliseum The [Clemson Tigers](https://www.on3.com/college/clemson-tigers/) had a magical run on the basketball court last March, reaching the Elite Eight for the first time since 1980. While they fell just short of a Final Four appearance, falling to Alabama 89-82, the Tigers’ historic run helped to kick up the enthusiasm and excitement surrounding their program. On Thursday morning, Clemson unveiled a brand-new basketball court for their fans and players to enjoy this season. Clemson basketball outlook for 2024-2025 Like many other teams across the country, the Clemson basketball roster will have an entirely new look in the 2024-2025 season. Former Tigers big man PJ Hall went undrafted in the 2024 NBA Draft, but eventually signed with the Denver Nuggets. The good news is Clemson returns one of their most important pieces, forward [Ian Schieffelin](https://www.on3.com/db/ian-schieffelin-48839/). He averaged 10.1 points, 9.4 rebounds, and 2.2 assists per game last year for the Tigers, playing a critical role in fueling their historic run to the Elite Eight. [CLICK HERE to go to PrizePicks and use code ON3 to receive a guaranteed $50 once you play $5 in lineups](https://prizepicks.onelink.me/ivHR/ON3)! In Clemson’s first round matchup in the NCAA Tournament against [New Mexico](https://www.on3.com/college/new-mexico-lobos/), “Schieffelin stuffed the stat sheet with 16 points and 12 rebounds in their blowout victory. He followed that up with solid showings against Baylor in the Round of 32 (11 points and six rebounds) and Arizona in the Sweet 16 (14 points and seven rebounds). To finish it off, he stuffed the stat sheet with a double-double in Clemson’s 89-82 loss to Alabama in the Elight Eight (18 points, 11 rebounds, and two assists). His return was massive for the Tigers’ 2024-2025 season, and he’ll once again be a critical player for their front court. He’ll be joined by Boston College transfer [Jaeden Zackery](https://www.on3.com/db/jaeden-zackery-162840/), who was quietly one of the more talented guards in the ACC last season. He put up pretty complete numbers last year, pumping in 11.3 points, 3.3 rebounds, and 4.2 assists for the Eagles. Zackery also shot 40.5% from three-point range. In the front court, Clemson went out and landed a high-level contributor at the power forward position, Illinois State transfer [Myles Foster](https://www.on3.com/db/myles-foster-178751/). He averaged 12.4 points per game and 8.1 rebounds per game last year for the Redbirds. He’ll help to replace some of the front court production vacated by [PJ Hall](https://www.on3.com/db/pj-hall-94868/). Clemson also plucked big man [Christian Reeves](https://www.on3.com/db/christian-reeves-23126/) from the Duke Blue Devils. He’s listed at 7-1, 261 pounds and joined the Tigers in the hopes of logging more minutes. He only averaged five minutes per game and 3.2 minutes per game in his first two seasons on the Blue Devils’ loaded roster. In the 2021-2022 season for Oak Hill Academy, Reeves averaged 9.2 points, while bringing in 7.4 rebounds. He chose Duke over Minnesota, South Carolina, and others. Those are just a few of the reasons for Clemson fans to get excited about the 2024-2025 campaign. It’ll be tough for the Tigers to top their magical run in the NCAA Tournament from this past year, but the pieces they’ve brought in this offseason should at least make them very competitive in the ACC.
